alert.note: Alert for Grant; Mineral (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued November 28 at 7:34AM EST until November 28 at 8:15AM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Sterling Virginia has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Southwestern Allegany County in western Maryland... Southwestern Garrett County in western Maryland... North central Grant County in eastern West Virginia... Southwestern Mineral County in eastern West Virginia... * Until 815 AM EST. * At 734 AM EST, a dangerous snow squall was located over Deer Park, or near Mountain Lake Park, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow. Gusty winds leading to blowing snow and visibility rapidly falling to less than one-quarter mile. Wind gusts up to 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Dangerous and life-threatening travel conditions are expected to develop rapidly in the warning area. Locations impacted include... Keyser, Mountain Lake Park, Oakland, Loch Lynn Heights, Deer Park, Elk Garden, Kitzmiller, Luke, Hutton, Crellin, Swallow Falls State Park, McComas Beach, Deep Creek Lake State Park, Sulphur City, Emoryville, Hartmansville, Warnocks, Mccoole, and Mount Pisgah. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Reduce speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions. SNOW SQUALL...RADAR INDICATED SNOW SQUALL IMPACT...SIGNIFICANT
